output.conclusion: This course provides a comprehensive understanding of the fundamental principles and advanced concepts in the Theory of Machines, equipping students with the knowledge and skills necessary for analyzing and designing mechanical systems.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Theory of Machines! This course delves into the intricacies of machine dynamics, kinematics, and mechanisms, building upon foundational knowledge to explore advanced topics and applications.

chapters.description: Introduction to kinematic chains, degrees of freedom, Gruebler's criterion, Kutzbach criterion, kinematic inversions, and mobility analysis of complex mechanisms.
Instantaneous center of rotation, Kennedy's theorem, graphical and analytical methods for velocity analysis of linkages and mechanisms.
Coriolis acceleration, graphical and analytical methods for acceleration analysis of linkages and mechanisms, including four-bar linkages and slider-crank mechanisms.
Static equilibrium of mechanisms, free-body diagrams, principle of virtual work, static force analysis of linkages with and without friction.
Inertia forces and torques, D'Alembert's principle, dynamic force analysis of linkages, balancing of rotating and reciprocating masses.
Energy fluctuation in machines, turning moment diagrams, flywheel design for speed regulation, coefficient of fluctuation of speed.
Free, damped, and forced vibrations, single degree of freedom systems, natural frequency, damping ratio, resonance, vibration isolation.
Equations of motion, natural frequencies and mode shapes, vibration absorbers, vibration isolation techniques for multi-degree of freedom systems.
Vibration of strings, rods, and beams, wave equation, natural frequencies and mode shapes of continuous systems.
Simple, compound, and epicyclic gear trains, velocity ratio calculations, torque and power transmission in gear trains.
Cam profile design, displacement diagrams, velocity and acceleration analysis of cam-follower systems, types of followers.
Static and dynamic balancing, balancing machines, influence coefficient method, balancing of multi-cylinder engines.
